intro: Adesmia arenicola, commonly known as the sand adesmia, is a low-growing shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its root system is extensive and adapted to anchor the plant in loose, sandy soils. Adesmia arenicola is well-suited to dry climates and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky outcrops.
